data.text: Bikepacking the American GREAT DIVIDE: Are Bears an Issue?

Hitting the American GREAT DIVIDE as of September 1st. Three questions: Are bears a huge issue? 45 mm rigid gravel or fully MTB? Anyone happen to be riding then? My holiday has been approved today ao no more variables lol.

Did the route in 2018. 1. Bears aren‚Äôt really an issue if you have a clean camp and keep food/toiletries away from the tent and hung/stored securely. Saying that I carried bear spray which is handy for any aggressive dogs. The issues main issues are motor vehicles and the sun. 2. I rode a rigid fast tourer with flat bars and Marathon Mondial 700x40C. It was fine most of the time. The majority of the route is reasonable graded, wide gravel roads. You‚Äôll have a great time. You‚Äôll have to expect some less than optimal weather leaving that late.

data.text: nobody is suggesting that you don‚Äôt go because of bears. But unlike many risks that you cannot control, negative bear encounters can mostly be avoided by following some simple steps. Those steps are not necessarily obvious or sometimes can be cumbersome- like preparing food away from your tent or not sleeping in the clothes you cooked in. Carrying bear spray (at least through Colorado) is extra weight. But these are real precautions that, if taken, will reduce encounters.
